title.narrative: Assessment of Recognized Seasonal Employer (RSE) Agents in Vanuatu

description.narrative: Seasonal labour migration facilitated through New Zealand’s Recognised Seasonal Employment (RSE) presents important economic, social and developmental benefits for Vanuatu as well as New Zealand. At present 23 registered agents have been given licenses to act as RSE agents. Such agents are particularly sought after by workers from rural, remote or non-urban areas who may have only limited information about the program, access to government services and offices, and resources to support application. IOM has been requested by the New Zealand High Commission in Vanuatu to carry out an assessment of the current practices for recruitment, orientation, visa processing and liaison functions through the agent modality. It will also assess whether the current system is effective and valued by potential migrants and their communities and determine whether the current financial compensation provided to agents by employers is adequate to cover the costs of their current functions. Thus, IOM’s work on this assessment will contribute to better protecting the rights of migrant workers for the benefit of NZ employers, Vanuatu communities, and migrants themselves.
